ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to write and discuss in an academic setting. How to write an independent research paper. Skills that set up college-level essay writing.

This class was good about acclimating me to the college writing style. Instead of writing to summarize facts I learned like I was taught in high school, I learned to write even research papers to reason out an argument.
Really interesting readings on war theory, especially readings on 9/11 and the war on terror era.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Maeva is an excellent instructor. The course content was interesting and the feedback received from Maeva was really helpful.

Weaknesses: A course called War Today attracts a certain demographic of students (something to keep in mind). The course's reading could've been ordered in a slightly different way to be more engaging.

Some of the readings were very interesting, and I especially liked "They Say/I Say." That format of writing everything as an argument helped me make my writing much more interesting and inspired, and I'll make sure to keep using it throughout my time in college. The seminar style of the class was great for meeting people and going in-depth into the assigned readings. The final project being relatively light (considering it comes after the research paper which is a much heavier load) is definitely appreciated.
I did not like some of the aspects of the 114 format. There seemed to be some vague key terms we were supposed to understand that were not very clearly defined (i.e. "problem") that were ultimately important in how we were supposed to write our essays.
Not enough focus on modern war like AI and cyber/tech. Very good focus on writing.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes absolutely - take ENGL 114! It will teach you the writing skills you need for your entire Yale academic career.
Yes. Great way to get english/writing credit with very interesting and engaging content.
